comments:
After cancelling a Merge subscriber the folling exception occured. Everything 
seemed to still be working OK so it was probably related to the cancelled 
subscriber.


java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.NullPointerException.<init>(NullPointerException.java:63)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.sync.views.SyncSetInputFromSubscriber.getRoots
(SyncSetInputFromSubscriber.java:100)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.sync.views.SyncSetInputFromSubscriberWorkingSet.ge
tRoots(SyncSetInputFromSubscriberWorkingSet.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.sync.views.SubscriberInput.roots
(SubscriberInput.java:102)
	at 
org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.jobs.RefreshSubscriberInputJob.getResources
(RefreshSubscriberInputJob.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.jobs.RefreshSubscriberJob.shouldRun
(RefreshSubscriberJob.java:103)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.startJob
(JobManager.java:449)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.WorkerPool.startJob
(WorkerPool.java:131)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:73)

This has been fixed. It was related to subscriberinputsyncsets not having a
subscriber until local changes were collected.
